definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Blame only themselves to blame "book, two sages heart read-only window his ears."
sentences.chinese: 怪只怪自己“一心只读圣贤书，两耳不闻窗外事。”

sentences.english: "Two outside the window, his ears heart read-only sages book" already do not apply.
sentences.chinese: “两耳不闻窗外事，一心只读圣贤书”已不适用。

sentences.english: Is there a contradiction between reading sacred books and looking for the way of immortality?
sentences.chinese: 读圣贤书，而求神仙不死之道，其间是否矛盾？

definition: the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
to read extensively and thoroughly/nonstandard pronunciation of a Chinese character, e.g. the reading [hao4] in 愛好|爱好[ai4 hao4] rather than the usual [hao3]
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
